page.title: 07Wildlife near Holbeach Bank
page.content: In our area there are lots of dykes and we get mallards, swans, herons, shelduck and moorhens.They make their nests on the sides of the dykes.The banks are steep and enemies can not get them.The rabbits make burrows in the ground in the corn field.Hares make there forms in spring.The nest is under a hedge.The foxes make dens in the grass at the sides of the fields. The pheasant nests on the ground in the corn fields.The first pheasants were introduced into our area by a local farmer about the year 1900.He asked those who lived round about not to shoot any pheasant for the first 5 years, so enabling the stock to increase.Now the pheasants live wild all over the area.
